post: On Our American Stories, BRIs Kirk Higgins shares the extraordinary courage of Lt. John Robert Fox, 1 of the 7 Black soldiers awarded the Medal of Honor for WWII. His sacrifice reminds us why teaching civic virtue matters. Listen:  https://ihr.fm/4oSPvhp  #AmericanHistory  #CivicVirtue  #Leadership  #MedalOfHonor  #BRI  #OurAmericanStories

This Thanksgiving, were thankful for teachers who bring civics to life every day. Your work helps students connect gratitude, service, and citizenship to Americas 250th. Log 1 Civic Star activity and keep building that legacy. 🔗  https://bit.ly/3V1CQuX  #CivicStarChallenge  #CivicVirtues  #CivicEducation  #Gratitude  #America250
Check out this fantastic opportunity at my organization where were helping transform the landscape of U. S. history and civic education!

How did the Bible influence the American Founding? In this Scholar Talks episode, legal scholar Daniel Dreisbach discusses how Scripture shaped ideas about human nature, virtue, checks and balances, and republican self-government. What perspectives stand out to you? Watch:  https://bit.ly/3K0jche  #CivicEducation  #ScholarTalks  #CivicLeadership

Students learn the Constitution in class, but a physical copy makes it real. Now they have one thanks to your generosity.   Kyle M., Michigan educator This season, help teachers like Kyle bring the Constitution to life for their students. $1 = 1 Pocket Constitution ➡️  https://bit.ly/4mp0Epg  #CivicsChampion  #CivicEducation  #TeacherVoices  #Gratitude  #SupportTeachers

As Thanksgiving approaches, Think the Vote asks students to consider: Should families discuss politics at the dinner table? This debate explores civil discourse, gratitude, and navigating disagreement respectfully. Share with your students →  https://bit.ly/4rnJUBk  #CivicEducation  #ThinkTheVote  #TTV  #StudentVoice  #CriticalThinking

Many students are closer to a MyImpact Challenge submission than they think. If theyve helped their school or community this year, theyre already on the path to civic leadership. What kinds of projects do you see students taking on most often? 🌟 Share MyImpact Challenge with a student you know:  https://bit.ly/3fyGGr3  #MyImpactChallenge  #CivicLeadership  #YouthDevelopment  #CivicEngagement

Students from across the country came together in Washington, D. C. for the 2025 National Civics Bee, and BRI was honored to support them as the events official content partner. From drafting study materials and essay prompts to designing the team challenge and judging the final round, our staff helped champion civic literacy at the highest level. This generations commitment to thoughtful, informed citizenship is a reason for real optimism. What civic skills do you think matter most for students today? Read more:  https://bit.ly/3WZIi2G  #CivicsBee  #CivicsEducation  #CivicEngagement  #YouthLeadership  #BRI

📜  #OTD in 1863, Abraham Lincoln delivered the Gettysburg Address, honoring sacrifice while redefining the nations commitment to equality and self-government. How can this speech help students reflect on civic identity today? 🔗 Explore the lesson:  https://bit.ly/3G4BpEK  #TDiH  #GettysburgAddress  #AmericanHistory  #CivicEducation
